intro: Phyllis galopina, commonly known as the golden star, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, five-petaled yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs. Phyllis galopina is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partial shade.
